name: Hilton Garden Inn Oshkosh

reviews.text: We had an awesome stay. The Rooms are HUGE - nice Queen Beds with adjustable mattress. Linens were great. Breakfast the next day was included in our room and was worth half the price of our room. Great place to stay.
reviews.title: Excellent Value and Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: I recently stayed here for my 26th birthday. I called and reserved a room ahead of time and the lady that worked there help me get the best price. When we showed up I was very impressed with the front lobby and how elegant/clean it was. After a quick check in from the friendly lady at the front, we went to our room. When we walked in it felt like we were the first ones there. It was EXTREMELY clean. The room was very modern in style and both beds had padding that could be adjusted from soft to hard for each side which was awesome. The bathroom was VERY clean and all the products (lotion, shampoo, etc) was Neutrogena. The hotel is very close to all downtown fun so after going out for my birthday we came back and went swimming in the pool that is open 24 hours. DID I MENTION 24 HOURS?? And when we were heading out the next day I found a little mouthwash bottle too which was perfect. The only complaint was that the bathroom didn't have a ceiling fan...that was it. I don't know how people can complain. Unless you live in a castle with servants and gold toilets, this hotel is plenty good for the price. I used to live in Oshkosh but will stay here for any events. It was great.
reviews.title: Fun stay.

reviews.text: Recent visit to Oshkosh, this HGI was well staffed and friendly, good breakfast in the morning and the hotel is kept very clean! One observation was a loose water spout in the tub - all in all a great stay and will definitely stay again!
reviews.title: Clean, great service, personnel and location!

reviews.text: For rural WI, this is hands-down the best hotel. The extended restaurant and bar are a huge plus. Pricepoint is just right as well. Acceptable as far as cleansliness and customer service are concerned.
reviews.title: Shines

reviews.text: Other Hiltons are nicer, very slow drains and more water came out of the leak near the wall mount than the shower head. Staff was fine.
reviews.title: Ok I suppose

reviews.text: Nicely situated near main highways. Close to Appleton, too. The only two critical things I have to say is that the air conditioning units are loud and distracting. It is either on full blast and noisy or off. Not regulated well. Also, one of the beds, which was supposed to be adjustable, was not in working order, so half the bed was hard, and the other half very soft.
reviews.title: Good value, accommodating staff.

reviews.text: Still, a good stay, good breakfast and service, and a fair price.
reviews.title: Excellent location, clean and reliable staff.

reviews.text: Stayed here twice in June. Both stays were pleasant. This is your typical Hilton Garden Inn. Very clean, excellent location (especially for EAA fans - right on the airport), indoor pool, fitness center, FREE business center, reliable wireless Internet, very comfortable beds and inviting rooms. There is a restaurant in the hotel and a bar. Breakfast is not free unless it is included in your rate FYI. The rate was not by any means competitive to other hotels nearby. However, I choose HGI solely on predictability and reliability.
reviews.title: Polter-Guest

reviews.text: Just returned from a two night stay for a family event. Most of the staff were friendly and we had positive experience checking in (allowed us to check in before noon) and checking out (with one quick phone call). All facilities were clean and in working order--over the course of my stay, spent time in the lobby, lounge, meeting rooms, outdoor deck, and business center--all good with no surprises.
reviews.title: I would stay here again!

reviews.text: The hotel is located parallel to one of the oshkosh airport runways, so it is an interesting view if you are into that sort of thing. The property is convenient to the main drags of the area and is easy to locate.
reviews.title: Spacious room, understanding staff

reviews.text: Hotel staff was friendly. Rooms need to be remodeled and could have been a little cleaner. Overall not a bad stay.
reviews.title: Okay stay

reviews.text: My initial thought of reserving a room at a Hilton Garden Inn was the expectation of quality and of a higher standard, this was not to be. Initially everything was okay, my first morning there I brewed a pot of coffee in my room, had a couple cups and went on my way. Upon returning that evening I went to set up the coffee pot for the next morning, picked up a coffee cup only to find it already used! There were coffee stains on the bottom of the cup, presumably from where I had used it that morning (my cup???). I took the cup down to the front desk and showed the counter person on duty who found me a clean cup as a replacement. To make a long story short, I returned to my room that evening (day 2) to find the coffee area cleaned and my dirty cup, from that morning, again set up as though it was a clean cup. Now I am wondering what else isn't clean in this room and building? My impression was that the staff really have an issue with caring and are riding on the Hilton name which is going the way of gold finishes on 1980 fixtures. Slow drains, low water pressure, noisy AC, poor windows and iffy elevators complete this 'gem' of a bygone era, that should be left there. Replace the staff and refurbish the building!
reviews.title: Coffee anyone?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly service. Clean room. Good location. That's what you expect and that is what you get with the Hilton Garden Inns. Quiet location.
reviews.title: Hilton Garden Inns Always tops

reviews.text: Having stayed at other Hiltons and enjoyed my stay, I expected the same quality again. My husband and I stayed here for a wedding recently. The front desk person was friendly and the bed was comfy, thats about all that I was happy with. I was first disappointed by the dirty shower (covered in someone's hair), then by the noise. We could hear people in the room next to us talking and others through the vent in our bathroom. Being that we were on the first floor, the noise was pretty loud coming from the hallway as well in the morning. Our dining experience- for a wedding reception it was not great: cold food, I heard a lot of people complaining :(....I would look elsewhere
reviews.title: Not what I expected from Hilton

reviews.text: The Oshkosh Hilton Garden Inn is a decent hotel but is definitely starting to show some wear and tear. The rooms are okay but the carpet is worn and the hotel is not as clean as I would've expected. Overall though, the place is fine. My bigger concern was that I was given a room on the first floor. I just happened to look out of the window (which was partially blocked by large bushes) and noticed that the large sliding window was unlocked (no screen). There were 2 latches on the window and both were unlocked. It would've been very easy for someone to simply slide open the window and enter the room. Given the weather and the location of the room, it was hard to believe that a previous guest inadvertently left the window unlocked. The fact that the large bushes in front of the window would shield an intruder from being seen from the parking lot made it even more suspcious. In summary, I'd probably stay at this hotel again but definitely not of the ground level.
reviews.title: Good, but not great..beware of 1st floor rooms

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn for the EAA Airventure and the AYA Convention and couldn't have asked for a better place. The staff in particular were exceptional - friendly, helpful, and accommodating at all times. The hotel and our room was spotless and any time we needed anything, the staff was very willing to take care of the request. Kudos to Chris at the front desk - he volunteered to take me and a friend around town in the hotel van - thanks so much! We'll be back!
reviews.title: Wonderful place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here after AirVenture for our own type club convention. The rooms are very roomy and we overlooked the airport and hotel plane parking ramp. Our club had many taxiing and parking type events which took place on the hotel parking ramp. They have a very nice overhead patio with tables and chairs which overlooks this area so it was very 'civilized' to sit and enjoy the activities in the shade. Bars were good as was the restaurant.
reviews.title: An example of Hilton quality

reviews.text: We stayed here during EAA AirVenture, and finally after 4 years were able to stay at this hotel..
reviews.title: Good stay during EAA AirVenture

reviews.text: The price of the hotel is very very high ($359 per night plus tax) which I knew, but I wanted to see if it was worth it..
reviews.title: Great place to stay during AirVenture

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very well sitauted, you just had to walk through the back lot to the gate and you basically could get access to the shuttle (North 40) to take you to an Admissions gate, the view of the runway and planes was spectacular
reviews.title: Always a Winner

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Oshkosh Hotel Oshkosh
description: Plan your next stay at the Hilton Garden Inn Oshkosh located right off Highway 42 on Witman Airfield. We are near the EAA Aviation Center. We are also close to other area businesses such as Oshkosh Corporation and Miles Kimball. We also offer private airplane parking. Guest rooms include free internet and the Garden Sleep System. Relax in our pool or whirlpool or use our fitness facility.
